remarks: Given a finite multiplication of values betweeen 0 and 1, a value E larger than any multiplicand, is larger than the whole multiplication. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
fmul01lt1.1 $e |- F/_ i B $.
fmul01lt1.2 $e |- F/ i ph $.
fmul01lt1.3 $e |- F/_ j A $.
fmul01lt1.4 $e |- A = seq 1 ( x. , B ) $.
fmul01lt1.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
fmul01lt1.6 $e |- ( ph -> B : ( 1 ... M ) --> RR ) $.
fmul01lt1.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 1 ... M ) ) -> 0 <_ ( B ` i ) ) $.
fmul01lt1.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 1 ... M ) ) -> ( B ` i ) <_ 1 ) $.
fmul01lt1.9 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
fmul01lt1.10 $e |- ( ph -> E. j e. ( 1 ... M ) ( B ` j ) < E ) $.
fmul01lt1 $p |- ( ph -> ( A ` M ) < E ) $.
$d E i j $.
$d M i j $.
$d j ph $.
